content:
Here are the system requirements for Capture One and On1 Photo RAW:

**Capture One:**

**Minimum System Requirements:**

* Windows:
	+ Operating System: Windows 10 (64-bit)
	+ Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 8 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 or AMD Radeon HD 7870 (OpenGL 4.3 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space
* macOS:
	+ Operating System: macOS High Sierra (10.13) or later
	+ Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 8 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 or AMD Radeon HD 7870 (OpenGL 4.3 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space

**Recommended System Requirements:**

* Windows:
	+ Operating System: Windows 10 (64-bit)
	+ Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 16 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 or AMD Radeon R9 390 (OpenGL 4.5 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space
* macOS:
	+ Operating System: macOS Mojave (10.14) or later
	+ Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 16 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 or AMD Radeon R9 390 (OpenGL 4.5 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space

**On1 Photo RAW:**

**Minimum System Requirements:**

* Windows:
	+ Operating System: Windows 10 (64-bit)
	+ Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 8 GB
	+ Graphics Card: OpenGL 3.3 or later
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space
* macOS:
	+ Operating System: macOS High Sierra (10.13) or later
	+ Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 8 GB
	+ Graphics Card: OpenGL 3.3 or later
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space

**Recommended System Requirements:**

* Windows:
	+ Operating System: Windows 10 (64-bit)
	+ Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 16 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 or AMD Radeon HD 7970 (OpenGL 4.4 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space
* macOS:
	+ Operating System: macOS Mojave (10.14) or later
	+ Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
	+ RAM: 16 GB
	+ Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 or AMD Radeon HD 7970 (OpenGL 4.4 or later)
	+ Hard Drive: 10 GB free space

Keep in mind that these are the minimum and recommended system requirements, and the actual performance may vary depending on the complexity of your images, the number of files you're working with, and other factors.

If your laptop meets the minimum system requirements, you can still try running the software, but you might experience slower performance or limitations. If your laptop is several years old, you might want to consider upgrading your hardware or looking into cloud-based photo editing solutions that don't require as much processing power.

I hope this helps!
